isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - REPAIRING OR REPLACING PARTS

svcproc.title: REPAIRING OR REPLACING PARTS
svcproc.para: Replace worn or damaged parts of the axle assembly. Refer to MT514 in the Master Parts Book for the correct part numbers.

step1.para: Replace any fastener if the corners of the head are worn.
Replace the gaskets, oil seals or grease seals at the time of axle or carrier repair.

warning.para: Small amounts of acid vapor are present when applying silicone gasket material. To prevent possible serious personal injury, make sure there is good ventilation in the work area. If the silicone gasket material gets in your eyes, flush your eyes with water for 15 minutes. Have your eyes checked by a doctor.

step1.para: Clean the parts and apply new silicone gasket material where required when the axle or carrier is assembled ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Apply New Silicone Gasket Material Where Required

step1.para: Remove nicks, mars and burrs from parts having machined or ground surfaces. Use a fine file, India stone, emery cloth or crocus cloth for this purpose.
Clean and repair the threads of fasteners and holes. Use a die or tap of the correct size or a fine file for this purpose.

caution.para: Threads must be clean and undamaged so that accurate adjustments and correct torque values can be applied to fasteners and parts.

step1.para: Tighten all fasteners to the correct torque values. Refer to the TORQUE CHART ( Figure 64).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Tighten Fasteners to Correct Torque Values

caution.para: DO NOT repair axle housings by bending or straightening. Repair of axle housings by bending or straightening will cause poor performance, early failure and possible unsafe operation of the axle. Do not attempt this type of repair.
